page.title: 07Crichton Church
page.content: Crichton Church was built in 1449 by Lord Chancellor Crichton and was dedicated to St Mungo.The church was built about 500yds from his great castle, which is now a historical ruin. The church would serve the the occupiers of the castle, the inhabitants of Crichton village and surrounding area. It is still used as a place of worship only on alternate Sundays along with Cranston Kirk. The original structure of the building has changed slightly. A roof has been lowered and part has been added at the back. The roof is not original either. It was formerly a collegiate church which means religious people studied there.It is still a very beautiful old stone church.
